article.text: The Lebanese army reopened the Naameh coastal road in southern Lebanon on the Saida-Beirut highway after some young men blocked it with burning tires, the National News Agency reported on Sunday. The road was blocked to protest the murder of Sheikh Ahmad Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard Mohammad Hussein Merheb. Meanwhile, Al-Manar television reported that the army also reopened the Khaldeh road after protesters had blocked it. Army troops shot dead Sunni cleric Abdel Wahed on Sunday when his convoy failed to stop at a checkpoint in North Lebanon, the scene of deadly clashes linked to the uprising in Syria, a security official said according to AFP. The sheikh’s bodyguard, Merheb, was also killed.-NOW Lebanon
